Sections.Text: Cornelius Bosch has finally completed his new home, a remote haven where he can carry out his research in private, away from ignorant society scolds and envious rivals.
Decades spent plundering the darkest corners of existence have left Bosch close to death, even as he is on the threshold of unlocking the secrets of immortality.
The restless spirits of the dead already serve at his beck and call, but Bosch seeks something greater than a ghostly eternity.
But his work has not gone unnoticed by the covetous Tyrees, petty dillettente dabblers in the occult who think their money can win them any prize.
Bosch has refused Tyree thrice in the past. Now the fiend is at his door, hoping to steal the secrets of Bosch's undying labors.
Bosch call up the spirits of the dead to defend his secrets from the Tyrees!
The angry shades of the workers who died building Bosch Manor serve on in death, bringing agony to anything they touch.
Lost Souls from the beyond crackle with deadly ectoplasmic energy that can strike at the Tyrees from a distance. They cannot open doors, so need a shade or Bosch to lead the way.
